title: Guy Mannering
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: My ancestor was a little alarmed, for, like theGoodman of Lochside, he had more money about his person than hecared to risk in such society.

title: Guy Mannering
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: As soon as day dawned, Jean roused herguest, produced his horse, which she had accommodated behind thehallan, and guided him for some miles, till he was on the high-roadto Lochside.

title: Guy Mannering
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: "'E'en the winsome Gudeman of Lochside, poor body,' replied Jean;'he's been at Newcastle seeking siller to pay his rent, honest man,but deil-be-lickit he's been able to gather in, and sae he's gaune'en hame wi' a toom purse and a sair heart.'

title: Guy Mannering
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: "Jean set up a loud shout of joyful recognition--'Eh, sirs! thewinsome Gudeman of Lochside! Light down, light down; for ye maunnagang farther the night, and a friend's house sae near.'

title: Guy Mannering
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: "It happened, in course of time, that in consequence Of sometemporary pecuniary necessity, the Goodman of Lochside was obligedto go to Newcastle to raise some money to pay his rent.

title: Guy Mannering
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Jean was mortified at this ungratefulconduct, and so much ashamed of it, that she absented herself fromLochside for several years.

title: Guy Mannering
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Having beenoften hospitably received at the farm-house of Lochside, nearYetholm, she had carefully abstained from committing anydepredations an the farmer's property.

title: The Abbot
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: "Conduct her safe!" exclaimed the incensed waiting-woman, while MagdalenGraeme left the apartment; "I say, duck her in the loch, and then wewill see whether she is witch or not, as every body in the village ofLochside will say and swear.
